turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: We aren't completely stupid.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Stay in the light! Everybody! Stay in the fucking --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Hey, <u>you're</u> the one who got me out here, turned me into a goddamn sled dog. An' now you 'spect me to go back like a <u>whipped</u> dog?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I was wrong. I admit it. My bad, okay? Now let's just go back to the ship.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I dunno. Nice breeze, wide open spaces -- you know, I'm startin' to enjoy myself out here.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Are you fucking high again? Just listen to --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: No, no, you're right, Fry. What's to be afraid of? My life is a steamin' pile of meaningless toadshit anyhow. So I say mush on! Canyon's only couple hundred meters, after that we're in Skiff City! So why don't you just butch up, stuff a cork in that kid, and get --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: This does not help us, Johns.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: -- she tried to blow the whole fucking passenger cabin, tried to kill us --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Just shut up, okay?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: -- tried to kill us in our sleep. Paris had it right -- we <u>are</u> disposable. We're just walking ghosts to her.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Would you RAG YOUR STUPID HOLE!

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: We cannot go through there....

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: How much you weigh right now, Fry? Huh?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: It's the atmosphere. Too much pressure, not enough oxygen. Might take a few days to --

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: So what the bloody hell happened, anyways?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Somethin' knocked us off-lane. Maybe a rogue comet. Maybe we'll never know.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Well? Is it just the pump?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Ask if anyone has anything in cargo! Anything to drink!

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Imam. We should leave soon. Before nightfall but while it's cooler.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: What, you're goin' off, too?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Johns is leaving you a gun. Just do me a favor, huh? Get my crewies buried? They were good guys who died bad.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Why did I fall on you?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: He's dead. Cap'n's dead. Christ, I was looking right at him when --

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: I mean, I mean, chrono shows we're 22 weeks out, so gravity wasn't supposed to kick in for another 19. I mean, I mean, I mean, why did I fall <u>at all</u>?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You hear me? Captain's dead. Owens too.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Oh, no. Not Owens, not.... Wai', wai', wait. <u>I'm Owens</u>. Right?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: 1550 millibars, dropping 20 MB per minute, shit, we're hemorrhaging air. <u>Somethin'</u> took a swipe at us.

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Just tell me we're still in the shipping lane. Just show me all those stars, all those bright, beautiful, deep-space....

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Fry?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Can't get my nose down...too much load back there....

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: You mean that "load" of passengers?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: So what, we should both go down too? Out of sheer fucking nobility?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: Look, Fry. Company says we're responsible for every one of those --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Company's not here, is it?

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: When captain went down, you stepped up -- whether you like it or not. Now they train you for this, so --

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: And there wasn't a simulated cockroach alive within 50 clicks of the simulated crash site! <u>That's</u> how they train you! On a fucking simulator!

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Owens!

turns.speaker: OWENS
turns.text: 70 seconds! You still got 70 seconds to level this beast out!

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I don't suppose....

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: One of the Christian habits we <u>didn't</u> adopt -- perhaps unfortunately. We'll have to wait.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: So quiet. You get used to the sounds of the ship, then....

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: You know who Muhammad was?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Some prophet guy?

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: "Some prophet guy." And a city man. But he had to travel to the desert -- where there was quiet -- to hear the words of God.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: You were on a pilgrimage? To New Mecca?

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Chrislam teaches that once in every lifetime should there be a great hajj -- a great pilgrimage. To know God, better, yes, but to know yourself as well.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Frightening thought.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: We're all on the same hajj now.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: One is all?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: For now.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: I saw the cut-marks on the bones. Wasn't a natural die-off.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Quiet, please. Everyone.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Hasan?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Riddick?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: They're afraid of our light. That means we don't have to be so afraid of them.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: And you're certain you can find the way back? Even in the dark?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: No, I'm not. But <u>he</u> can.

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Imam. Slow down.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Don't stop, just slow down.  Little more space 'tween us and them.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: I would rather we all stay--

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Do what I say. Please.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: The sled as a shield....

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: And what about the cells?

turns.speaker: FRY
turns.text: Oh, no. No, no, no....

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Rain.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Has anyone seen the young one? Ali?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Has anyone checked the coring room?

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Well...we must keep her close, then. Here, she'll be safe if we put her between --

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: There is no "safe."

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Where's Mr. Johns?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Which half?

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: You mean....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: What're you doin'?

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Blessing you like the others.  It's painless.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: And pointless.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: I see. Well, even if you don't believe in God, it doesn't mean He won't be --

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: You <u>don't</u> see.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: 'Cuz you don't spend half your life in lock-down with a horse-bit in your mouth and not believe. And you surely don't start out in a liquor store trash bin with an umbilical cord wrapped around your neck and not believe. Oh, absolutely I believe in God. And I absolutely hate the fucker.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: He will be with us. Nonetheless.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Give my blessing to the girl. She needs a spare.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Suleiman!

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Get the girl back under. Keep going.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: SULEIMAN!

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: KEEP GOING OR I WILL!

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: New Mecca....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Think a soul could get lost there? With all those pilgrim-types?

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: It's more a place where souls are found, Mr. Riddick.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: For what? There is no water. You understand that, don't you?

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: All deserts have water, somewhere. God shall lead us there.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: "God is Great," yes?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I'm born-again.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: We got you...it's okay, it's okay...we got you now....

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: The child heard you before any of us could even....

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: I had the impression...from the model... that the two planets were moving as one. That there would be...a lasting darkness.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Those suns gotta come back <u>sometime</u>. And if these animals really are phobic about light, we just sit tight till then.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Oh, Trash Baby, you're gonna regret this.

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: Please...this solves nothing...please....

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: We crossed our own tracks.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: He's running us 'round in circles. Look for yourself. Look!

turns.speaker: IMAM
turns.text: She's the captain, we should listen to --

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Listen to her? <u>Her</u>? When she was willing to sacrifice us all?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: ...then we saw this.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Anyone else having breathing problems? Aside from me?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: King Tut's tomb....

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Be surprised what these will fetch in the Taurus system. Here. This Wooten here -- easy, easy. Very rare.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: A toast to whatever he just said.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: I'll need a receipt for that.  For all these.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: What the hell are these?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Maratha crow-bill war-picks from Northern India. Very rare.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: So just like that. Wave your little wand and he's one of us now.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Didn't say that. But least this way I don't have to worry about falling asleep and not wakin' up.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Well, just a skiff. Disposable, really.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Like an emergency life-raft, right?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Very big beads.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Not staying in here another....

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: She's the pilot, she should stay close to the cells.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Oh, so I'm disposable?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Found somethin' worse than me, huh?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: We're movin'. And I'm just wondering if I shouldn't lighten the load right now.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Want you to remember this moment, Riddick. The way it coulda gone and didn't.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Say that again.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Here's the deal. You work without the chains, without the bit -- without the shivs. You help us get off this rock....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: For what? The honor of goin' back to some asshole of a cell?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Truth is, Riddick, I'm tired of this head-up shit. I wanna be free of you as much as you wanna be free of me.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: You'd cut me loose, Boss?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Only if we both get outta this alive. And there may be a way.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: My recommendation: Do me. Don't take the chance that I'll get shiv-happy on your wannabe ass. Ghost me, Riddick. Would if I were you.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: If you were me, I'd kill us both. C'mon, you wanna sit at the grown-up table or not?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Are you fuckin' kidding me?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Not afraid of the dark, are you?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I'd rather piss glass.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Well, you got the big gauge.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Wanna rag your fat mouth?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Think about that reward, Johns.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: I'm willing to take a cut in pay.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: How 'bout a cut in your gut?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: <u>Fuck me</u>. You said "clear."

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Said "looks clear."

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Well, what's it look like now?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Looks clear.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Such as.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Hard to tell, sometimes...even for me... but looked like a bunch of those big boys chewin' each other's gonads off. Thought we'd swing wide. Okay by you?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: About how to kill us and still get these cells to the skiff. Goddamnit, we're just doin' the heavy lifting for this prick!

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: About the girl.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: What're you jaw-jackin' about? Girl's not cut.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: No. She's not.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Aw, this can't be happening to me....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: They been nose-open for her ever since we left. They go off blood.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Ain't all of us gonna make it.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Just realized that, huh?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Six of us left. If we could get through that canyon and lose just one, that'd be quite a fucking feat, huh? A good thing, right?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Not if I'm the one.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: What if you're one of five?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Look, it's hellified stuff -- but no different than those battlefield doctors when they have to decide who lives and who dies. It's called "triage," okay?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Kept calling it "murder" when I did it.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Either way, figure it's something you can grab onto.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Sacrifice play. Hack up one body, leave it at start of the canyon. Like a bucket of chum.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: <u>Trawl</u> with it. There's a cable on the sled. We can drag the body behind us.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Nice embellishment.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Don't wanna feed these land-sharks -- just keep 'em off our scent.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: So which one caught your eye?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Don' look, don' look, don' look....

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: What's her name, anyway?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: What do you care?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Then let's not name the Thanksgiving turkey, okay? I assume you still got a shiv.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: What, you 'spect <u>me</u> to do it?

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: What's one more to you? Like <u>this</u> is the one that sends you to Hell?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Oh, you're a piece of art, Johns. They oughtta hang you in a museum somewhere. Or forget the museum -- maybe they should just hang you.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Aw, don't tell me you're growin' scruples.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Just wonderin' if we don't need a bigger piece of chum.

turns.speaker: JOHNS
turns.text: Like who, Mr. Chrislam?

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: An' this?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Blow-dart hunting stick from Papua New Guinea. Very <u>very</u> rare, since the tribe's extinct.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: 'Cuz they couldn't hunt shit with these things, be my guess.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Well, what's the need, anyway? If he's gone, he's gone. Why should he bother us?

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: So much for your nightfall.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: So much for my cocktail hour.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Amazing how you can do without the essentials of life -- so long as you have the luxuries.

turns.speaker: ZEKE
turns.text: Well, just keep your bloody-fuckin' eyes open. Don't want that ratbag sneakin' up on me bloody-fuckin' arse.

turns.speaker: SHAZZA
turns.text: Not a star-jumper.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Doesn't need to be. Use this to get back up to the Sol-Track Shipping Lanes, stick out a thumb. You'll get picked up.  Right?

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: What, you don't really think they left with their clothes on the lines? Photos on the walls?

turns.speaker: SHAZZA
turns.text: Maybe they had weight limits, you don't know.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: I know you don't uncrate your emergency ship unless there's a fucking emergency.

turns.speaker: SHAZZA
turns.text: You were tryin' to kill him too.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: Just wanted his O-2.  Though I notice he tried to ghost my ass. When he shot up that stranger instead.

turns.speaker: SHAZZA
turns.text: Take it.

turns.speaker: RIDDICK
turns.text: What, it's broken?

turns.speaker: SHAZZA
turns.text: Startin' to acclimate, anyhow. Take it.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Cornelius, if you have a moment today, I'd like to discuss this expedition of yours in more detail.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Certainly, sir. I'll get my notes and come right over.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Dr. Zaius --

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Did you forget our appointment, Cornelius?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Oh., no., sir. I was just assembling my notes.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: You know Dr. Maximus, our Commissioner for Animal Affairs?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Certainly, sir. It's a pleasure to see you again.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: He exceeded his orders. His travel permit was promptly revoked.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Yes, sir, so it was -- thanks to you. But not before I discovered evidence of a simian culture that existed long before the Sacred Scrolls were written ...

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: How did you know we'd come here?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: It wasn't difficult. Only an apostate or a lunatic would flee to the Forbidden Zone.  I see you brought along the female of your species.  I didn't realize a man could be monogamous.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: I ask you to reconsider the rash course you've taken. If you're convicted of heresy, the most you'll get is two years. But if you persist in pointing guns in my direction, you'll hang for high treason.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: We've never meant to be treasonable, sir.  But up there, in the face of that Cliff, is a vast cave -- and in that cave a fabulous treasure of fossils and artifacts.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: I've seen some of your fossils and artifacts. They're worthless.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Indeed, the very fact that these tools are unknown to us could suggest a culture in certain ways almost equal to our own. Some of the evidence is uncontestable ...

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Don't speak to me in absolutes. The evidence is contestable.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: I apologize.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: To begin with, your methods of dating the past are crude, to say the least. There are geologists on my staff who would laugh at your speculations.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: A doll alone proves nothing. True. But the doll was found beside the jawbone of a man -- and no trace of simian fossils has turned up in this deposit.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Your conclusion is premature. Have you forgotten your Scripture? The Thirteenth Scroll?  'And Proteus brought the upright beast into the garden, and chained him to a tree, and the children made sport of him.'

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: No sir, I haven't forgotten.

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: Well? For a time the ancients kept humans as household pets.	Until the Lawgiver proved that man could not be tamed. Keep digging Cornelius. You'll find evidence of the master of this house: an ape.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Seal the cave?

turns.speaker: ZAIUS
turns.text: That's correct. And you will both stand trial for heresy.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Well, Taylor -- we're all fugitives now.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Do you have any weapons?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: The best. But we won't need them.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Just the same, I want one.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: As you wish.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Zaius seems to think there might be another jungle beyond the Forbidden Zone. That's what  we'll try for. What about you?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: To the diggings I worked at a year ago. It's a three day ride across the eastern desert, near where you claim you landed from that planet of yours.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You still don't believe me, do you?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: It's a long detour to Dead Lake. What would we find?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Nothing much. The remnants of a life raft. Maybe a small flag. The emblem of my countrymen.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Sorry, Taylor. The terrain around that lake is poisonous. There is no fresh water, no vegetation. Nothing.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I know ... Nevertheless, I thank you for saving us. You'll be in trouble for going there.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Where does the river lead?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: It empties into a sea some miles from here. That's where the cave is.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You've never told me why this region's called the Forbidden Zone.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: No one really knows. It's an ancient taboo. Set forth in the Sacred Scrolls. The Lawgiver pronounced the area deadly.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: When are you going to show me what's in the cave?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Right now, if you like.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: If there's any shooting, Dr. Zaius, you'll be the first to die. Depend on it.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Taylor, you're not in command here. Put down that gun.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Taylor, I'd rather you -

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: No. You saved me from this fanatic. Maybe I can pay you back.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yes. I have to agree. From all you've found so far, his position's as good as yours.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: What are you doing there?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Reconstructing a life. Care to have a look?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: That was different. We thought you were .... inferior.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: And now you know the truth.  Cornelius has beaten you, Doctor. He proved it. Man preceded you here. You owe him your science, your language, whatever knowledge you have.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: They can't convict us of that. You proved our innocence. Besides...  ... his culture is our culture.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Good luck then.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Do you have to work tonight?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Neither do I.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: That's Bright Eyes. The one I was telling you about.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: What's so special about him?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Watch.  Hello, Bright Eyes. How's our throat today?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Look -- she remembers.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Remembers what?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: The blood transfusion.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Zira, come on. You know they can't --  Oh oh. Here comes Number One.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: It's a stunt. Humans don't write.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Dear, you're a scientist. Don't you believe your own eyes?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Where did you learn to do this?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Now, just a minute --

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Oh, Cornelius, be quiet.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: 'Dodge was killed in the hunt. What happened to Landon?'  I don't know.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: And they fell out of the sky with you?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Flight is a scientific impossibility.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: And even if it weren't, why fly? Where would it get you?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Cornelius, why do you insist on provoking him?

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: No creature can survive in that part of the Forbidden Zone. I've been there. I've seen it.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: 'Then how do you account for me?,

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: I don't. And I'm not going to try.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: But what about your theory? The existence of someone like Taylor might prove it.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Zira, are you trying to get my head cut off?

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Don't be foolish. If it's true, they'll have to accept it.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: No, they won't -

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Cornelius has developed a brilliant hypothesis -

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: It's probably wrong --

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: -- that the ape evolved from a lower order of primate, possibly man. In his trip to the Forbidden Zone he discovered traces of a culture older than recorded time -

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: The evidence was very meager --

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: You didn't think so then.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: That was before Dr. Zaius and half the Academy said the idea was heresy.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: How can scientific truth be heresy? What if Taylor is exactly the proof you needed? A mutation. A missing link between the unevolved primate and the ape -

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: 'I am not a missing link.'

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Because if he is a missing link, it means the Sacred Scrolls aren't worth their parchment.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Well, maybe they're not.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: No, thank you'. I won't get into that battle.

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: Oh, Cornelius, show some strength!

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Zira, listen to me. We've got a fine future ahead of us. Marriage. Stimulating careers. I'm up for a raise --

turns.speaker: ZIRA
turns.text: A toy. It floats on the air.  Try it.

turns.speaker: CORNELIUS
turns.text: Zira....
